speaker: duncan
dialog: What bloody man is that? He can report, as seemeth by his plight, of the revolt the newest state.

speaker: malcolm
dialog: This is the sergeant who like a good and hardy soldier fought 'gainst my captivity. Hail, brave friend! Say to the king the knowledge of the broil as thou didst leave it.

speaker: sergeant
dialog: Doubtful it stood; as two spent swimmers, that do cling together and choke their art. The merciless Macdonwald--

speaker: sergeant
dialog: Worthy to be a rebel, for to that the multiplying villanies of nature do swarm upon him--from the western isles

speaker: sergeant
dialog: Of kerns and gallowglasses is supplied; and fortune, on his damned quarrel smiling, show'd like a rebel's whore: but all's too weak: for brave Macbeth--well he deserves that name--

speaker: sergeant
dialog: Disdaining fortune, with his brandish'd steel, which smoked with bloody execution, like valour's minion carved out his passage till he faced the slave;

speaker: sergeant
dialog: Which ne'er shook hands, nor bade farewell to him, till he unseam'd him from the nave to the chaps, and fix'd his head upon our battlements.

speaker: duncan
dialog: O valiant cousin! worthy gentleman!.

speaker: sergeant
dialog: As whence the sun 'gins his reflection shipwrecking storms and direful thunders break, so from that spring whence comfort seem'd to come discomfort swells. Mark, king of Scotland, mark:

speaker: sergeant
dialog: No sooner justice had with valour arm'd compell'd these skipping kerns to trust their heels, but the Norweyan lord surveying vantage, with furbish'd arms and new supplies of men began a fresh assault.

speaker: duncan
dialog: Dismay'd not this our captains, Macbeth and Banquo?

speaker: sergeant
dialog: Yes; as sparrows eagles, or the hare the lion. If I say sooth, I must report they were as cannons overcharged with double cracks, so they doubly redoubled strokes upon the foe:

speaker: sergeant
dialog: Except they meant to bathe in reeking wounds, or memorise another Golgotha, I cannot tell. But I am faint, my gashes cry for help.

speaker: duncan
dialog: So well thy words become thee as thy wounds; they smack of honour both. Go get him surgeons. Who comes here?

speaker: malcolm
dialog: The worthy thane of Ross.

speaker: lennox
dialog: What a haste looks through his eyes! So should he look that seems to speak things strange.

speaker: ross
dialog: God save the king!

speaker: duncan
dialog: Whence camest thou, worthy thane?

speaker: ross
dialog: From Fife, great king; where the Norweyan banners flout the sky and fan our people cold. Norway himself, with terrible numbers, assisted by that most disloyal traitor the thane of Cawdor, began a dismal conflict;

speaker: ross
dialog: Till that Bellona's bridegroom, lapp'd in proof, confronted him with self-comparisons, point against point rebellious, arm 'gainst arm. Curbing his lavish spirit: and, to conclude, the victory fell on us.

speaker: duncan
dialog: Great happiness!

speaker: ross
dialog: That now sweno, the Norways' king, craves composition: nor would we deign him burial of his men till he disbursed at Saint Colme's inch ten thousand dollars to our general use.

speaker: duncan
dialog: No more that thane of Cawdor shall deceive our bosom interest: go pronounce his present death, and with his former title greet Macbeth.

speaker: ross
dialog: I'll see it done.

speaker: duncan
dialog: What he hath lost noble Macbeth hath won.
